alert.note: Alert for Kodiak Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 21 at 9:52PM AKDT until March 22 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 10 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 6 inches with locally higher amounts across interior locations of Kodiak Island. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches for Kodiak City. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Communities along the western and southern portions of Kodiak Island, including Larsen Bay, Karluk, Akhiok, and Old Harbor. * WHEN...From 4 AM to 10 PM AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A strong storm system will move from west of Akhiok Tuesday night to east of Kodiak City by early Wednesday afternoon. As it does, a mix of rain and snow will changeover to snow for western and southern Kodiak Island. Gusty northwesterly winds will also develop across the southern half of the island by early Wednesday morning. Several inches of snow is expected for communities across the western and southern portions of the island. The combination of snow and wind could reduce visibility to as low as one half mile at times before snow tapers off Wednesday evening. A mix of rain and snow is also expected to change to snow along northern and eastern portions of the island Wednesday as winds shift from the east to the northwest. However, warmer temperatures along the eastern half of the island will likely limit blowing snow potential. Prolonged easterly winds along the eastern coast will also keep the potential for rain to mix in with snow at times, limiting total snow accumulations.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
